senses.de: a person's unique way of writing their name
senses.ex: Mr. White signed the contract with his signature.

Tips.title: Personal Identification
Tips.description: Used as proof of one's identity, often required on official documents.
Tips.example: Please, add your signature here to confirm your identity.

Tips.title: Legally Binding
Tips.description: Indicates agreement or consent, especially in legal contracts or forms.
Tips.example: By providing your signature, you agree to the terms.

Tips.title: Physical Act
Tips.description: Usually involves a pen and paper, but can also include electronic methods.
Tips.example: She practiced writing her signature on the paper.

senses.ex: The signature styles of the artist make his work recognizable.

Tips.title: Creator's Mark
Tips.description: Reflects someone's personal style or brand distinctly in various contexts.
Tips.example: The chef is known for his signature spicy salsa.

Tips.title: Recognition Tool
Tips.description: Enables others to identify or associate the product or work with its creator.
Tips.example: The fashion designer's signature look includes bold patterns.

senses.de: a collection of sheets of paper bound together in a book
senses.ex: Each signature of the book was printed separately.

Tips.title: Printing Jargon
Tips.description: Specific to the publishing and book-making industry, less common in everyday use.
Tips.example: The printer arranged the pages into signatures before binding.

Tips.title: Binding Concern
Tips.description: Important for understanding how books are assembled and how many pages they have.
Tips.example: This textbook has about seven signatures, each with 16 pages.

senses.de: a sequence of characters that identifies or verifies the sender of data
senses.ex: The programmer used a digital signature to secure the software.

Tips.title: Digital Security
Tips.description: Verifies authorship and integrity of electronic documents and software.
Tips.example: The email was verified with the sender's digital signature.

Tips.title: Tech Authenticity
Tips.description: Ensures the recipient that the digital content is safe and not tampered with.
Tips.example: The digital signature ensures the software hasn’t been altered.

senses.de: A set of musical notes that show the key of a piece of music
senses.ex: The piece was written in F major, as reflected in its key signature.

Tips.title: Music Theory Basics
Tips.description: Essential for musicians to comprehend the tonality and scale of a piece.
Tips.example: The key signature indicated that the music was in C sharp minor.

Tips.title: Rhythm Indicator
Tips.description: Refers to time signature, which informs the beat and tempo of the music piece.
Tips.example: A time signature of 4/4 means there are four beats per measure.

Autograph.wordDefinition:
An autograph is typically used to refer to a signature of a famous or notable person, such as a celebrity or athlete. Autographs are often valued for their personal or historical significance and may be collected or sold.

In summary, while the terms autograph and signature are often used interchangeably, autograph specifically refers to a famous person's signature, while a signature is any written mark made for identification or approval.

Endorse.wordDefinition: Endorse means to publicly support or approve of something, such as a product or a candidate.

Inscription.wordDefinition:
An inscription is a piece of writing that is put on something to explain or give important information.

It can be a message, dedication, or label. An inscription is applicable in places like monuments, plaques, books, or gifts.

An inscription is a piece of writing that explains or labels something, while a signature is a person's name or mark to validate or identify.

Mark.wordDefinition:
Mark refers to a symbol or design that is used to identify something.

It can be used for many things like marking an exam paper, a price tag, or a sign for a brand.

A mark can be any symbol used for identification, whereas a signature is typically a person's name written in a unique style for identification purposes.

Moniker.wordDefinition:
A moniker is a name or nickname that someone is known by, while a signature is a person's unique way of writing their name.

Monikers are typically informal and given by friends or peers, while signatures are more formal and often used to sign important documents.

Monikers can be used in casual conversation, social media usernames, or as a stage name for performers, while signatures are typically reserved for legal documents or formal correspondence.

Seal.wordDefinition:
A seal is a special stamp or emblem that represents an organization, company or individual.

It is used to verify documents and shows that they come from the authorized source. For example, a university might have a seal that is placed on diplomas to show that it is an official document from the university.

A seal is typically used by an organization or entity to verify official documents, while a signature is a personal identification mark used to authenticate an individual's agreement to a document or agreement.

Sign.wordDefinition:
Sign refers to writing your name or making a mark to indicate your agreement or acknowledgment of something.

It can be used in many different contexts, such as signing a contract, signing a guestbook, or signing a document.

Signature refers specifically to your unique style of writing your name.

It is often used in the context of legal documents or official forms, where your signature is required for verification or approval.

Sign means to write your name or make a mark, while signature refers to your unique writing style. You use sign when you need to indicate your agreement or acknowledgment of something, and signature when a legal or official document requires your unique mark.

Symbol.wordDefinition:
A symbol is an object, shape or picture that represents something else.

A symbol can be used to represent an idea, concept or object.

For example, the cross is a symbol of Christianity, while the dove is a symbol of peace.

Symbols can be used to represent something in a visual way, and they can be used in many different contexts.

In summary, while a signature is a personal mark that shows approval or agreement, a symbol is a visual representation of an idea, concept or object.

A signature is typically used for legal purposes, while a symbol can be used in many contexts, including religious, cultural, and social contexts.

quotes.Text: I want to evolve each season. I never want to be one of those brands where people know what they're going to see. I always want an element of surprise. One thing I never want to do is copy what anybody else is doing. I have a signature, and it's very important to me to stay true to that.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Victoria Beckham

quotes.Text: You know, I'm behind my company. My company has been a big part of my life. And it's not that I been buying a company or that my father bought a company and tried to do something out of it. You know, it's not the same thing. It's my name, it's my company, it's my signature.
quotes.Title: French Designer
quotes.Name: Christian Louboutin

quotes.Text: That's one thing I don't think people consider nowadays. They want to believe in the importance of marriage, boil it down to just a signature on a legal document. But that's exactly what it is. If not, why not just get married without one?
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Ariel Pink

quotes.Text: The good life consists in deriving happiness by using your signature strengths every day in the main realms of living. The meaningful life adds one more component: using these same strengths to forward knowledge, power or goodness.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Martin Seligman

quotes.Text: I guess I did make my name out of my drumming, and I have the big drum sets, and I'm doing all these crazy, odd-time signatures, so, yeah, I guess drumming was very important to what made me popular.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mike Portnoy

quotes.Text: In Budapest, I always had questions. What is your signature dish? They, of course, said goulash. I loved it so much and now have to figure out a way to make it at home.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Tia Mowry

quotes.Text: I'm against a signature look, as that can be very outdating. But having said that, I also know my best qualities, so I'm not going to foolhardily give away my power.
quotes.Title: Somali Model
quotes.Name: Iman

quotes.Text: I had a messy signature as a child, and my grandmother said this suggested I had no regard for other people. She was right.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Chris Ware

quotes.Text: A signature always reveals a man's character - and sometimes even his name.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Evan Esar

quotes.Text: A man's kiss is his signature.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Mae West
